api_settings_modal.title: Edit {{ api | capitalize }} Settings
api_settings_modal.success: The credentials are valid. You need to save them before continuing.

twitter.p1: Follow these instructions to generate tokens to use the Twitter API.
twitter.p2: Replace consumer_key, consumer_secret, access_token, and access_token_secret with the keys from your app.

facebook.p1: Visit your apps on the Facebook developers site. Create a new app if needed.
facebook.p2: Inside your Facebook app, obtain client_id and client_secret.
facebook.p3: To obtain an access token, in a browser, visit https://graph.facebook.com/oauth/access_token?client_secret=xxx&client_id=xxx&grant_type=client_credentials using your client_id and client_secret.
facebook.p4: Replace the accessToken placeholder with your access token.

elmo.p1: Log in to your ELMO instance with an account having coordinator or higher privileges on the mission you want to track.
elmo.p2: In your ELMO instance, mark one or more forms as public (via the Edit Form page). Note the Form ID in the URL bar (e.g. if URL ends in /m/mymission/forms/123, the ID is 123).
elmo.p3: Visit your profile page (click the icon bearing your username in the top-right corner) and copy your API key (click 'Regenerate' if necessary).
elmo.p4: Set the value of authToken to the API key you obtained above.

gplaces.p1: If you do not have a API key for Google Places you can get one from Google's API console.
gplaces.p2: You need to reload the page after saving the key for the changes to have effect.

api_settings_modal.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete the settings for this source?

A short name for this source.

sources_modal.help: Separated by commas, e.g. apple, passion fruit, banana. Note that passion fruit will match tweets containing both passion and fruit in any order. See here for details.
sources_modal.rss_url: The URL of the RSS feed, e.g. http://example.com/rss.xml
sources_modal.tags: Separated by commas, e.g. apple, passion fruit, banana
sources_modal.facebook_url: The URL of the Facebook page or group, e.g. https://www.facebook.com/i.love.cats.in
sources_modal.elmo_url: The URL of the ELMO instance, e.g. https://abc.getelmo.org
sources_modal.whatsapp_help: Check Aggie documentation for instructions on how to set the keyword and WhatsApp forwarding in Firefox
